intro: Stenocephalum penicillatum, commonly known as the narrow-headed bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, narrow leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of branches. It is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions.
